tweet: I’m angered by the dismissal of this landmark suit. I've visited refugee camps around the world—What I saw today is a disgrace to the United States.
 
The conditions to which we are submitting asylum-seekers is inhumane, plain and simple. This crisis is a direct result the #RemainInMexico policy and it must end at once. pic.twitter.com/8GrFJoJo1H

Medical personnel on the ground say the situation in Matamoros is so bad, they need the same type of support and infrastructure that is given to the formal refugee camps in the Middle East. #DemsAtTheBorder #DontLookAway pic.twitter.com/9RsvPFnlHt

Briefing from Mike with Team Brownsville, a volunteer organization providing humanitarian assistance, and Sister Norma from @CCharitiesUSA. Matamoros has neither the medical resources nor infrastructure to accommodate the asylum-seekers. pic.twitter.com/3iE0O1d20G

Preparing to enter Matamoros, Mexico, where more than 3K asylum-seekers are waiting for their claims to be processed. The conditions at the tent camps are inhumane, with reports of violence, kidnappings, sexual assault, and widespread illness. pic.twitter.com/1TzosPAcv6

Today I am visiting the U.S.-Mexico border to see firsthand the impact of the Trump Administration's #RemainInMexico policy.

First up: a meeting with @ACLUTx, @TXCivilRights , and @ABA_Immigration. pic.twitter.com/EfvJZbrkMa

Today the House appointed impeachment managers and sent two articles of impeachment to the Senate. Now it’s up to the Senate to hold a fair trial—including allowing necessary documents and witness testimonies—on the President's betrayal of the Constitution. History is watching.

A century ago today, Oregon became the 25th state to ratify the #19thAmendment, taking the first step towards granting all women the right to vote. Oregon's suffragists made major strides in expanding access to the ballot box—a fight that continues today. #womensvote100 pic.twitter.com/SSrhdVMhGG

Trump put our troops in harm’s way with his reckless assassination of Suleimani. Instead of violent attacks that may potentially to lead to all-out war, Congress must stop this march towards war. We cannot afford to become mired in another endless conflict in the Middle East.

George W. Bush’s invasion of Iraq mired U.S. troops in a never-ending conflict and was the worst foreign policy mistake in recent history. However, Trump’s dangerous efforts to provoke Iran into war may have even greater consequences. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/04/world/middleeast/iran-suleimani-killing.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share …

Trump's order to assassinate Iran's top military leader will have a major impact across the Middle East and may endanger American servicemembers' lives. Congress must assert its Constitutionally-granted war powers to ensure the US does not become mired in yet another endless war.
